Selected Answer: A
A. Cross-border data transfer

Cross-border data transfer should be the primary consideration for a multinational organization deploying a User and Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA) tool to centralize the monitoring of anomalous employee behavior. This is due to different data privacy laws and regulations that exist in various countries. For example, countries in the European Union are governed by the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), which has strict rules about the transfer of personal data outside of the EU. Similarly, other countries have their own data protection laws. Therefore, when centralizing monitoring, a company must ensure that it complies with all relevant data privacy laws to avoid penalties and reputational damage.
